definitions.definition: To crush with the teeth by repeated closing and opening of the jaws ; done to food to soften it and break it down by the action of saliva before it is swallowed .
examples: Make sure to chew thoroughly, and don't talk with your mouth full!
The steak was tough to chew as it had been cooked too long.

definitions.definition: To grind , tear , or otherwise degrade or demolish something with teeth or as with teeth.
examples: He keeps his feed in steel drums to prevent the mice from chewing holes in the feed-sacks.
The harsh desert wind and sand had chewed the stump into ragged strips of wood.

definitions.definition: To think about something; to ponder ; to chew over .
examples: The professor stood at the blackboard, chalk in hand, and chewed the question the student had asked.

main_definition: To crush with the teeth by repeated closing and opening of the jaws ; done to food to soften it and break it down by the action of saliva before it is swallowed .
secondary_definitions: To grind , tear , or otherwise degrade or demolish something with teeth or as with teeth.
( informal ) To think about something; to ponder ; to chew over .
